definitions.definition: To lay or place; to put (one thing to another)
examples: to apply cream to a rash

definitions.definition: To put to use; to use or employ for a particular purpose, or in a particular case
examples: to apply funds to the repayment of a debt

definitions.definition: To make use of, declare, or pronounce, as suitable , fitting , or relevant .
examples: We need to apply the skills we’ve learned to solve this problem.

definitions.definition: To put closely; to join ; to engage and employ diligently or with attention.

examples: My parents say I could do well in school if I would apply myself.

definitions.definition: To submit oneself as a candidate (with the adposition " to " or " at " designating the recipient of the submission, and the adposition " for " designating the position).
examples: I recently applied to the tavern for a job as a bartender.
Most of the colleges she applied to were ones she thought she had a good chance of getting into.
Many of them don't know it, but almost a third of the inmates are eligible to apply for parole or work-release programs.
That rule only applies to foreigners.

definitions.definition: To busy; to keep at work; to ply .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To lay or place; to put (one thing to another)
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To put to use; to use or employ for a particular purpose, or in a particular case
( transitive ) To make use of, declare, or pronounce, as suitable , fitting , or relevant .
( transitive ) To put closely; to join ; to engage and employ diligently or with attention.
( reflexive ) To work diligently and attentively.
( transitive , usually reflexive ) To address oneself; to refer .
( intransitive ) To submit oneself as a candidate (with the adposition " to " or " at " designating the recipient of the submission, and the adposition " for " designating the position).
( intransitive ) To pertain or be relevant .
( obsolete ) To busy; to keep at work; to ply .
